body:
Hello,


So have been playing on this crappy laptop for 3 years now and am looking for a new PC. I am looking for PC around $500 to $1800AUD. Desktop or Laptop. So let me know if there are any decent PCs out there that are worth buy

Cheers, iHumptyDumptyi
body_tagged:

replies.body:
Any chance you can build it?

Pre-built PCs are overpriced and not fast.

And with that budget we have a lot to work with c;

replies.body:
Games?
Settings for those games (Low, Medium, High, Max)?
Will you be recording?
Will you be uploading videos?
Will you be streaming?

Here's a Red build I made that you can check out, it goes over you budget just by $30, but I'm sure that can be resolved by removing some parts and replacing them with cheaper ones, while not losing or gaining performance (https://au.pcpartpicker.com/user/Wasting/saved/HCwBD3)
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
Actually, this is the exact build I was going for! At least with the GPU and processor, the rest is just preference (but Win 8, seriously xD).

Although, if he is recording, I would get a lower budget case, power supply and motherboard to make room for a good performing i7.

replies.body: Can someone tell me what I need for a good computer with high FPS?
replies.body_tagged: Can someone tell me what I need for a good computer with high FPS?

replies.body: Look, first understand computers, then buy one, by just seeing, you can't really tell, watch videos, ALOT OF THEM, learn about computers then go on about building one, smsh, You need a good combination, no bottle necks, research videos about your components, are you doing 1080p, at what refresh rate, @60, or @120, or @144, just do some research plz, you can't trust some of these people, some talk complete trash, and sorry but thats around 30% of all pc builders that try to help.
replies.body_tagged: Look, first understand computers, then buy one, by just seeing, you can't really tell, watch videos, ALOT OF THEM, learn about computers then go on about building one, smsh, You need a good combination, no bottle necks, research videos about your components, are you doing 1080p, at what refresh rate, @60, or @120, or @144, just do some research plz, you can't trust some of these people, some talk complete trash, and sorry but thats around 30% of all pc builders that try to help.

reply_to.body: Can someone tell me what I need for a good computer with high FPS?
reply_to.body_tagged: Can someone tell me what I need for a good computer with high FPS?

replies.body: Not much. I gave a 800$ CAN build that runs 1.8 at max settings, OptiFine  with a 16x edit and get around 120-300 FPS. 400-600 on 1.7.
replies.body_tagged: Not much. I gave a 800$ CAN build that runs 1.8 at max settings, OptiFine  with a 16x edit and get around 120-300 FPS. 400-600 on 1.7.

replies.body: Won't be streaming, If he wants for it to look nice, there... But he's not streaming, so I don't suppose an i7 will improve performance by that much.

replies.body:
Makes sense. I would still give a lot less money for some components and upgrade on the GPU or CPU. Seriously, paying 250$ for a mobo is just not necessary . I'm here with a 60$ mobo and I'm doing just fine.

Other than that, very nice build!
